meanings.definition: To make white or pale by extracting color; bleach.
meanings.sent1: She blanched the fabric to remove the stain.
meanings.sent2: The chef blanched the almonds before adding them to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating bugs made her blanch in disgust.
meanings.sent4: His face blanched with fear as he heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The sun blanched the once colorful painting, fading it to a pale hue.

meanings.definition: To scald in boiling water and remove the skin or outer covering of.
meanings.sent1: He blanched the tomatoes to easily peel off the skin.
meanings.sent2: The chef blanched the peaches before making a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent3: She blanched her fingers accidentally while cooking pasta.
meanings.sent4: The hot water blanched the vegetables quickly for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent5: The steam from the pot blanched her face as she leaned over to check the food.

meanings.definition: To become white or pale, as from shock or fear.
meanings.sent1: His face blanched when he saw the ghostly figure in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident made her blanch with worry.
meanings.sent3: She blanched at the sight of the creepy crawly spider.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected noise caused her to blanch in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight blanched the room, casting eerie shadows on the walls.
